title: Common Bond
Meta_Description: CommonBond was launched in 2012 and has now dispersed over $2 billion in private student loans. It all started with a simple idea: make student loans less expensive and easier to manage for everyone.
Meta_Keywords: Best Personal Loan, Cheap Rate Loans, Low rate loans, Low Interest rate loans, Low APR Loans, Best Mortgage Loans, Best Student Loans, Best Auto Loans, Best Credit cards

content: CommonBond is a 2012-founded online lender that provides both student debt refinancing and private student loans. Since then, they have funded more than $3 billion in student loans and have become a popular choice for many borrowers. Its refinancing loans are best suited to borrowers with a bachelor's degree who appreciate repayment flexibility. Its private student loans are ideal for students who want to have a co-signer and value customer service.
CommonBond provides loans to undergraduate and graduate students who enroll in the academic year. The school must be either Title IV or non-profit.
The majority of candidates must cosign with a friend, parent, or family member.
Before applying for private student loans, CommonBond recommends that all candidates complete the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
Borrowers must be a US citizen, permanent resident, or have a valid visa. Either the applicant or the cosigner must have a credit score of at least 660.

content: Private loans range from $2,000 to 100% of tuition, with a lifetime limit of $500,000.
Loans for refinancing are available up to $500,000 in total.
Student loans are available through CommonBond for undergraduate, graduate, MBA, dentistry, and medical students.
There are no application costs, origination fees, or prepayment penalties with CommonBond undergraduate, graduate, and refinancing loans.

Borrowers who refinance their mortgages have the option of selecting a "hybrid" repayment plan. The interest rate is set for the first five years of repayment before varying monthly for the remaining five years.
CommonBond provides loans to undergraduate, graduate, business, dentistry, and medical students. If you already have a student loan, you can refinance it with a CommonBond loan.
Rates are reasonable, ranging from 2.00 percent to 10.74 percent APR based on loan type and borrower credit score, and can be fixed or variable.

Plus, the lender has a charitable goal. Every time CommonBond completely covers a degree, the lender pays for one year of tuition for a student in need through the international education group Pencils of Promise.
